** Fires wither skulls at a faster rate the lower health it has.
* Boss bar has a different color.
* Doesn't regenerate health.
* Explodes not just when created, but also when half health, and killed.
* Has a different spawning and death animation.
* Health depends on the world's [[difficulty]]. They have {{hp|300}} on Easy, {{hp|450}} on Normal, and {{hp|600}} on Hard, opposed to {{hp|300}} in ''Java Edition''.
* Wither skull projectiles can be deflected.
* Blue wither skull projectiles can be deflected when hit.
* Can break [[Nether Portal (block)|nether portals]], and [[End Gateway (block)|end gateways]], and cannot break [[structure void]]s.

'''[[Zombie]]s'''
* Will break off from chasing a player to target closer villagers and golems.
* Can see villagers through walls.

'''[[Zombie horse]]s'''
* Are attacked by the [[conduit]].

'''[[Zombie villager]]s'''
* Nitwit zombie villagers can become employed after being cured.
* Saving and reloading the world causes the curing process to finish as soon as the chunk containing the villager is ticked.
* Zombie villagers spawn in groups.
* Zombie villagers never count towards mob caps.

'''[[Zombified piglin]]s'''
* Using the classic texture pack turns the zombified piglin back into a classic zombie pigman.
* Have exclusive attack animations.

== World generation ==
'''[[The Nether]]'''
* Caves below the [[lava]] sea are not filled with lava.

'''[[The End]]'''
* Uses one biome ([[The End (biome)|The End]]) to generate the whole dimension.
** This does not result in any gameplay or generation differences.

'''[[Void]]'''
* A layer of [[invisible bedrock]] generates in the void in all dimensions to prevent players from falling further down.
* Has the same color as the [[sky]].
* Entities take void damage at slightly lower depths.
* Players in [[Creative]] mode don't take damage in the void.

'''[[World boundary]]'''
* A [[world border]] does not exist and the world attempts to generate infinitely. Teleporting is limited to 30,000,000 blocks from the origin.
* [[Bedrock Edition distance effects|Distance effects]] gradually increase at higher distances and make the game unplayable after a certain distance.
* The [[Bedrock Edition distance effects#Stripe Lands|Stripe Lands]] are a graphical glitch with some distorted physics, usually seen as the world boundary.
** Players next to water are teleported into the [[void]].
** Starts to generate at X/Z: ±16,777,216 and continues until the game's limits.
** Generated structures can still generate.
<gallery>
File:Stripe Lands.jpg|The Stripe Lands.
File:Corner Stripe Lands.jpg|The Corner Stripe Lands.
</gallery>

'''[[Flat world]]'''
* [[File:The Void with mobs.png|thumb|Mobs spawning on the void start platform.]]The Void preset uses the [[plains]] biome instead of [[The Void]], allowing [[mobs]] to spawn on the [[void start platform]].
* Has no structures generated in any preset.

'''[[Old]] world type'''
* A removed [[world type]]. Old worlds can no longer be created, but pre-existing old worlds remain. Old worlds can be converted to infinite worlds.
* Finite, 256×128×256 world; although NBT editing can change the size of the world or it's location in the world seed.
* Has some changed gameplay and other limitations.

'''[[Biome]]'''
* Almost every biome, including Nether and End biomes, has a unique [[water]] and water [[fog]] color.
* [[Dripstone caves]], [[meadow]]s, and [[cherry grove]]s are colder, allowing [[snowfall]] at lower elevations.
* Each biome has a unique snow accumulation height.

'''[[Badlands]]'''
* Generation of [[terracotta]] layers in the badlands have their y-axis varied by a few layers randomly across the x/z axis.

'''[[Jungle]]'''
* Generates slightly less tall jungle trees.

'''[[Snowy plains]] and [[frozen river]]'''
* No monsters other than strays and skeletons can naturally spawn here.

'''[[Swamp]]'''[[File:Swamp Vibrant Visuals.png|thumb|Huge mushrooms in a swamp.]]
* Generate with [[huge mushroom]]s.

'''[[Windswept gravelly hills]]'''[[File:Windswept Gravelly Hills Vibrant Visuals.png|thumb|Windswept gravelly hills in ''Bedrock Edition''.]]
* Surface is covered almost entirely with [[gravel]], with a few one block wide strips of [[grass blocks]] inside.
* Lacks of trees as the now unused [[gravelly mountains+]] biome served this purpose.

'''[[Windswept hills]]'''
* Lacks of trees as the [[windswept forest]] serves this purpose.

'''[[Structures]]'''
* Have display names and translations.

'''[[Buried treasure]]s'''
* Are much more common.
* Can generate in [[stony shore]] biomes.

'''[[Desert pyramid]]s'''
* Are slightly more common.
* If generated in a ravine or river, the temple's floor are replaced by the bottom of the ground in a ravine or river, rather than just one block from a TNT shape.
* If generated in stripe land, it has a very tall foundation to bedrock layer, unlike in deserts that never have a tall foundation if generated with air in the bottom.

'''[[Igloo]]s'''
* Generate with packed ice windows instead of ice.
* The [[villager]] spawned in the basement is from the snowy type and has a random profession.
* If generated in the stripe lands, it generates underwater at bedrock layer on the ocean floor, cutting some bedrock around it and replace the bottom bedrock at y=0 with stone bricks.

'''[[Jungle pyramid]]s'''
* Cannot generate in [[bamboo jungle]]s.

'''[[Ocean monument]]s'''
* Always generate at the same Y level, with the top of the roof at Y=56.

'''[[Ocean ruins]]'''
* Are much more common.

'''[[Pillager outpost|Pillager outposts]]'''[[File:Pillager outpost in taiga village.png|thumb|A pillager outpost in a snowy taiga village.]]
* Can generate with a tall foundation.
* Can generate in [[snowy taiga]]s and [[sunflower plains]].
* Can generate at any location regardless of nearby villages, even inside villages.

'''[[Shipwreck]]s'''
* Shipwrecks are present with their masts made of stripped logs.
* Acacia variants of shipwrecks can generate.

'''[[Stronghold]]s'''
* Has a larger chance to generate under a [[village]] meeting point to easily detect without an eye of ender, even when the [[eye of ender]] has been added.
* Number of strongholds able to generate per world is random instead of 128 per world.
** 3 strongholds generate in a ring centered at 0,0 and other strongholds generate infinitely around the world.
*The 5-way crossing room in strongholds usually has 1–4 entrances sealed.

'''[[Swamp hut]]s'''
* Cauldron is {{frac|1|3}} to {{frac|2|3}} filled with a random potion or splash potion.
* Can generate in [[swamp hills]].

'''[[Village]]s'''
* Plains tannery only generate a single cauldron. 
* Barrels in village fisher are empty.
* Village fisher generate fewer barrels than in ''Java Edition''.
* Taiga armorer don't spawn armor stands.
* Crafting tables generate in plains fisher.
* Taiga house chest loot is different.
* Can generate in [[snowy taiga]]s and [[sunflower plains]].

'''[[Woodland mansion]]s'''[[File:Desert mansion.png|thumb|A woodland mansion in a [[desert]], because lush caves generated underground.]]
* Can generate in [[lush caves]] and [[dripstone caves]].

'''[[Bonus chest]]'''
* Can contain [[sapling]]s and [[seed]]s.

'''[[Canyon]]s'''
* Are generally larger and deeper.

'''[[Coral reef]]s'''
* Coral crust include [[andesite]], [[granite]], [[diorite]], [[dead coral fan]], and [[Dead Coral Block|dead coral blocks]].
* Use NBT structure block generation.

'''[[Desert well]]s'''
* Generation is 1 in 500 chunks, rather than 1 in 1000.
* When generated, sometimes consist of 2 desert wells, rather than 1.

'''[[Erosion]]s'''
* Generate properly in all Overworld biomes.

'''[[Iceberg (feature)|Icebergs]]'''
* Generate twice as often.

'''[[Monster room]]s'''
* Can generate above sea level.

'''[[Nether portal]]'''
* If generated in mid-air, [[netherrack]] generates as a part of the generation, even in the Overworld.

'''[[Ore (feature)|Ores]]'''
* Can generate in polished andesite, diorite, and granite in structures.
* [[Ancient debris]] ores generate more often.

'''[[Tree]]s'''[[File:Dying Trees.jpg|thumb|Dying trees.]]
* Can generate and grow as a [[dying tree|dying]] variant, covered in [[vines]].

== Commands==
'''General'''
* Commands can be performend by [[NPC]]s and connected WebSocket servers.
* Most commands are not available at all in worlds with cheats disabled.
* A relative coordinate can have the next relative coordinate right behind it (without a space).
* The list of suggested inputs in the chat shows icons for blocks and items.

'''[[Target selectors]]'''
* <code>@initiator</code> exists to select players who click an [[NPC]] dialogue button.
* Can select targets by family, permission, item, and property.

'''Exclusive commands'''
* {{cmd|agent}}
** Used to let [[agent]]s perform certain actions.
* {{cmd|aimassist}}
** Modifies a player's aim assist.
* {{cmd|camera}}
** Used to customize the player's camera view in various ways.
* {{cmd|camerashake}}
** Used to make the player's camera shake.
* {{cmd|changesetting}}
** Server command to enable/disable cheats or change the [[difficulty]].
* {{cmd|clearrealmevents}}
** Resets [[Realms Stories#Realm Events|Realm Events]] on a server.
* {{cmd|clearspawnpoint}}
** Removes a player's spawn point in the world.
* {{cmd|codebuilder_actorinfo}}
* {{cmd|controlscheme}}
** Modifies player's control scheme of camera presets.
* {{cmd|daylock}}
** Locks the time to noon.
** {{cmd|alwaysday}} as alias.
* {{cmd|dedicatedwsserver}}
* {{cmd|dialogue}}
** Opens an NPC dialog on a player's screen, or can be used to change an NPC's dialog.
* {{cmd|drop}}
** Lets an [[agent]] drop specified items.
* {{cmd|enableencryption}}
** Enables encryption for WebSocket connections.
* {{cmd|event}}
** Triggers a [[spawn event]] for an entity.
* {{cmd|fog}}
** Manages [[fog]] settings for a player.
* {{cmd|gametips}}
** Enables or disables [[tutorial hint]]s.
* {{cmd|getlocalplayername}}
** Returns the local player name.
* {{cmd|gettopsolidblock}}
** Gets the position of the top non-air block below the specified position.
* {{cmd|hud}}
** Adjusts visibility of a specified [[HUD]] element.
* {{cmd|inputpermission}}
** Specifies permissions for operations (such as walking) for a player.
* {{cmd|listd}}
** Lists detail information about players on the server.
* {{cmd|mobevent}}
** Enables or disables the spawning of [[wandering trader]]s, [[illager patrol|pillager patrols]], and the [[ender dragon]]. This is controlled by [[game rule]]s in ''Java Edition''.
* {{cmd|music}}
** Plays and stops [[music]] or changes the volume or queue.
** In ''Java Edition'', the {{cmd|playsound}} command can be used instead.
* {{cmd|permission}}
** Lists, reloads, or sets [[player permissions]] on a server.
** {{cmd|ops}} as alias.
* {{cmd|playanimation}}
** Makes [[entities]] play various [[animation]]s.
* {{cmd|querytarget}}
** Gets transform, name, and id information about the given target entity or entities.
* {{cmd|reloadconfig}}
** Reloads configuration files relating to variables, permissions, etc.
* {{cmd|reloadpacketlimitconfig}}
** Reloads <code>packetlimitconfig.json</code> configuration file.
* {{cmd|replaceitem}}
** Replaces an item in a specified slot of a container block or entity's inventory.
* {{cmd|script}}
** Debugging options for GameTest Framework.
* {{cmd|scriptevent}}
** Triggers a script event with an ID and message.
* {{cmd|sendshowstoreoffer}}
** Shows store offers to a player.
* {{cmd|setmaxplayers}}
** Changes the maximum amount of players that can join the world.
* {{cmd|set_movement_authority}}
** Control the client or server to check a player movement.
* {{cmd|structure}}
** Saves and loads structures similar to [[structure block]]s.
* {{cmd|takepicture}}
** Takes a picture of a player or from a players view.
* {{cmd|testfor}}
** Counts entities matching specified conditions.
* {{cmd|testforblock}}
** Tests whether a certain block is in a specific location.
* {{cmd|testforblocks}}
** Tests whether the blocks in two regions match
* {{cmd|tickingarea}}
** Used to load chunks, similar to {{cmd|forceload}} in ''Java Edition''.
* {{cmd|toggledownfall}}
** Changes the weather between clear weather and precipitation.
* {{cmd|transferserver}}
** Transfers players to other [[server]]s.
* {{cmd|wsserver}}
** Used to connect the client to WebSocket servers.
** {{cmd|connect}} as alias.

'''{{cmd|gamerule}}'''
* More [[game rules]]:
** <code>functionCommandLimit</code><ref group="note">''Java Edition'' uses the maxChainCommandLength gamerule for this purpose.</ref>
** <code>recipesUnlock</code>
** <code>respawnBlocksExplode</code>
** <code>showBorderEffect</code>
** <code>showCoordinates</code>
** <code>showDaysPlayed</code>
** <code>showRecipeMessages</code>
** <code>showTags</code><ref group="note">''Java Edition'' uses the HideFlags item tag for this purpose.</ref>
* Certain gamerule commands are available even without turning on cheats.
* Disabling <code>doMobSpawning</code> gamerule prevents passive mobs and mobs from structures from spawning.

'''{{cmd|gamemode}} and {{cmd|difficulty}}'''
* Can be typed with abbreviated forms and numeric IDs.

'''{{cmd|help}}'''
* List of commands is organized into pages.
* {{cmd|?}} as alias.

'''{{cmd|save-all}}, {{cmd|save-off}} and {{cmd|save-on}}'''
* Are all merged into {{cmd|save}}.

'''{{cmd|teleport}}'''
* Has optional boolean to cancel teleporting if it ends up inside collision boxes of blocks.

'''{{cmd|time}}'''
* Time can be set to sunrise and sunset.

'''{{cmd|title}}'''
* {{cmd|title}} does not support raw JSON text, only plain strings, instead {{cmd|titleraw}} exists to allow raw JSON text.

'''{{cmd|weather}}'''
* Can be used to show the current weather.
